output_list.criticism: The mintToken function allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value, which can lead to integer overflow and potentially cause the contract to be unusable or lose tokens.
The transfer function allows a malicious contract to halt the transfer of tokens, which can lead to integer overflow and potentially cause the contract to be unusable or lose tokens.
The buy function does not check return value of sell function, allowing a potential trap for attackers.
The sell function allows a potential trap for attackers.
The setPrices function allows attackers to set arbitrary sell and buy prices.
